D., 1869, which said bonds shall bear interest at the rate of seven per centum per annum; which said interest shall be payable in gold or silver coin of the United States, on the first days of January and July, of every year, at the Treasury, in the city of Austin, and the principal of said bonds shall be paid when the same shall become due, at the Treasury, in the city of Austin, in gold or silver coin of the United
Ordinances Passed by theStates; and the said bonds when duly executed, shall be received by the Governor in lieu of the six per cent. bonds now held by the State for the indebtedness of said Railroad company to the State, and upon their delivery to the Governor, the said six per cent. bonds shall be cancelled and returned to said Railroad company.

2. The bonds provided for in the foregoing section, shall be a lien on the twenty-one miles of the Southern Pacific Railroad which have been heretofore constructed within the limits of the State of Texas; provided further, that the State shall have a lien upon all the additional road built by said company.

3. Upon the twenty-one miles of road now constructed in the State of Texas, and upon which the State has a lien by virtue of the six per cent. bonds of said company, now held by the State, the company shall never make or issue any bonds other than those provided in the foregoing section, to be issued to the Governor for the indebtedness of the com-
pany to the School Fund, for a larger sum than eight thousand dollars per mile; nor shall said company make or issue any bond other than those provided for in the preceding section, which shall be a lien upon said twenty-one miles of said road, unless the same, before it is put in circulation or delivered to any person, shall be countersigned by the Governor of the State of Texas, and also by the Comptroller of Public Accounts; nor shall any lien held by any person upon said twenty-one miles of said road by virtue of any bond which may be issued by said company, be foreclosed except in a court of competent jurisdiction, and after at least ninety days’ notice in writing to the Governor of the State, of the suit of foreclosure.
4. The said Railroad Company shall have the right, if it shall think proper to do so, to change the garage of said road.
5. The Legislature shall have the power at any time to make such regulations respecting said road as may be necessary to the security of the bonds held by the State.

div2.head: DECLARATION

opener.salute: Changing the County Seat of Refugio County.

div2.p: Be it declared by the people of Texas in Convention assembled, That the county seat of Refugio county, shall hereafter be at the town of St. Mary, in said county, and remain there until removed by law.

div2.head: DECLARATION

opener.salute: To incorporate the Texas Mutual Life Insurance Company.

div2.p: Be it declared by the people of Texas in Convention assembled:

Section 1. That T. W. House, W. R. Baker, Ed. Sharp, C. W. Hite, E. S. Graham, T. H. McMahan, W. H. Hankins, A. R. Crow, and A. J. Evans, or such of them, or as many of them as shall act, their associates, successors and assigns, he, and are hereby created a body corporate and politic, by the name and style of “The Texas Mutual Life Insurance Company;” with perpetual succession and full powers to contract and be contracted with, sue and be sued, and to acquire, by purchase, deeds of conveyance, lease, or other lawful manner; and the same to have, hold, use, and enjoy, any real or personal property, bonds, notes, or other securities for money, which the Board of Directors of said company may deem advisable in pursuance of the business of the company; and the same, or any part thereof, to sell, convey, lease, assign, transfer, or otherwise dispose of; and to do and perform, for the well-being of said company, whatever shall lawfully pertain to such corporate bodies; and may have and use a corporate seal.

Sec. 2. That the capital stock of said company shall not exceed $500,000 at the organization of the same; but may, at any time there-
after, be increased by the Board of Directors to not more than $1,000,-
000.

Sec. 3. That the capital stock of said company shall be divided into shares of $50 each, and which may be disposed of by the corporators or Board of Directors, in such manner, and on such terms, as they may from time to time determine.

Sec. 4. That the above-named corporators, or as many of them as may act, and their associates or assigns, shall have power to organize said com-
pany, in the city of Houston, county of Harris and State of Texas, and shall constitute the first Board of Directors, and shall hold their offices until their successors are duly elected and qualified; may appoint a Presi-
dent of the Board, Secretary and Treasurer, and such other officers and agents as may be necessary, and they shall have power to fill all vacan-
cies. A majority of said board shall constitute a quorum to do and trans-
act business. That after the organization of the company, as above pro-
vided, the Board of Directors shall have power, before opening books for general subscription to the capital stock, and before any subscription shall be binding on the company, to require the payment, to them, of not
Ordinances Passed by themore than twenty per cent. on each share subscribed, as may be required by them, and may have the residue subscribed, secured to their satisfac-
tion, and which obligations shall be payable on call installments and may be required to be renewed at any time, for the whole or such part, as the Board of Directors may determine; and it shall be the duty of the Board of Directors to give at least thirty days’ notice, by mail or otherwise, to all shareholders whose residence is known to the company, of any call they may make for any payment of installment required, which is unpaid; and if any stockholder shall fail to meet such call, or to secure the remainder, as aforesaid, it shall be lawful for the Board of Directors to sell such delinquent shares and transfer the same to the purchaser, or to declare them forfeited to the company, together with all previous payments thereon.

Sec. 5. The stock of the company shall be assignable and transfer-
able, under such rules and regulations as the company may establish or the Directors adopt; but no transfer of stock shall be deemed valid and binding against the company so long as the person transferring the same shall be indebted to the company, until the amount of such in-
debtedness is paid or secured. And the stock of every stockholder shall be considered and held as collateral security for the payment of any sum or sums which he or she may be indebted to the company, by notes for stock or otherwise.

Sec. 6. The number of directors and the time of electing them shall be determined by the by-laws, rules and regulations which the company may adopt, and may be changed at the pleasure of the same. In all elections held by stockholders, each share, to the number of twenty, shall have one vote; and for each ten additional shares the owner shall be entitled to one vote in addition. But no person shall be entitled to vote who is not at the time a bona fide stockholder, or whose stock has not been regularly transferred upon the books of the company; and shares may be voted upon by the executor or administrator of a de-
ceased owner, or by proxy.

Sec. 7. That the President and Directors for the time being shall have power to appoint such officers and agents under them and at such places as they shall deem necessary and proper for transacting the busi-
ness of the company, and to allow such compensation as may be agreed upon, and to require and to take bond and security for the faithful dis-
charge of their respective duties and trusts. And the said Board of Directors shall have power to make such by-laws, and adopt such regu-
lations for the government of the corporation, its agents and business officers, as they may deem necessary; and may repeal, alter or amend the same at pleasure.

Sec. 8. The President and Directors for the time being shall have
Constitutional Convention.power and authority, in the name and for the benefit of the company, to take risks and effect insurance on lives (single or joint) of males or females, by sea or water, or on land, for any time or for the whole period of natural life; and to contract for, grant and sell annuities; and to make all kinds of contracts in which casualties to life are involved; likewise to insure against accidents from any external causes producing death or any personal injury whatever; issue evidences of insurance against bodily accidents and injury; pay compensation therefor, as may be contracted for and specified in the terms of the policy; and every such contract, bargain, evidence, agreement or policy made by said corporation shall be in writing or in print, and shall be signed by the President and Secretary; but no such contract shall be binding upon the company until countersigned by the agent taking the risk.

Sec. 9. That it shall be lawful for any married woman, with the consent of her husband, by herself and in her name, or in the name of any third person with her assent, and that of her husband as her trustee, to cause to be insured for her sole use and benefit the life of her husband, for any definite period, or for the term of his natural life; or against accidents resulting in personal injury, causing him to be permanently or partially disabled or injured: and in case of such wife surviving her husband and the policy becoming due and payable, ac-
cording to the terms of the insurance, shall be payable to the wife, for her sole use and benefit, free from the claims of the representatives of the husband, or of any of his creditors. In case of the death of the wife before the decease of the husband, then, and in that case, the amount of the insurance shall be payable, after death, to her children; or, if under age, to their guardian, for their use.

Sec. 10. That the President and Board of Directors shall have power to borrow money to an amount not exceeding the capital stock actually taken, and at a rate of interest not exceeding ten per cent. per annum, and to issue stock or bonds for the payment of the same; and any part of the assets of said corporation may be mortgaged or pledged for the payment of such indebtedness, principal and interest; and the Board of Directors shall have power to loan or invest any portion of the un-
employed capital of said corporation, in such manner, on such terms of discount and interest, and on such security, as they may determine and authorize, not inconsistent with the laws of the State.

Sec. 11. That whenever said corporation shall be notified of any loss, by injury or death, occurring on any of the policies or evidences of insurance, granted or issued by the authority of the same, and on
Ordinances Passed by thewhich, they are legally liable, it shall be the duty of said corporation to pay the amount so insured, in accordance with the terms, agreements and conditions of such policies or evidences of insurance, within ninety days after such notification; and the Board of Directors may require such evidence and proof of death or injury as they may deem proper and conclusive, before paying such loss; provided, always, that in all cases where there has been no violation, on the part of the assured, of any of the conditions of the policy or evidence of insurance; and the Board, of Directors may attach such conditions to their policies or evidences of insurance, as they may deem right and proper for the good of the company and the assured.

Sec. 12. That it shall be lawful for the Board of Directors to issue participating policies ill which the assured will receive an equitable pro-
portion of profits, payable annually after five years from the date of the policy and which profits shall be predicated upon the annual pre-
mium received from the assured, and shall not amount to more than fifty per cent. of the annual rates, as shown by the Carlyle tables of mortality; and if, in the opinion of the said Board of Directors, or their successors or assigns, the assent of a majority of the stockholders hav-
ing first been obtained, it shall be deemed expedient to issue policies only and exclusively on the mutual plan, where all the net profits will be divided among the policy holders or members, then the original capital shall be refunded with interest, as the Board may order, to the original stockholders, their assigns, administrators, heirs or legal repre-
sentatives; and such returned amounts, with interest, shall be in lieu for such stock originally issued to said stockholders; and they shall, in that case, surrender their stock certificates, and the same shall be cancelled and destroyed; and the business of the company shall then be carried on on the plan of mutual life insurance, in which all the as-
sured shall equally participate in the profits, losses, management and supervision of said corporation.

Sec. 13. That it shall be lawful for any person or persons, male or female, to insure the life of himself, or themselves, or of any other person or persons, male or female, with his or their assent, for his and their own use and benefit, or that of their representatives, heirs or as-
signs, for any period.
Sec. 14. Nothing in this declaration shall be construed to authorize said corporation to engage in the business of circulating bank notes, or other paper, as a circulating medium.

Sec. 15. None but citizens of this State shall be entitled to the posi-
tion of director in this company, and all such persons (directors) must be stockholders therein.
Sec. 16. That this declaration shall take effect and be in force from and after its passage.

div2.head: DECLARATION

opener.salute:
In relation to the New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Com-
pany, a corporation of the State of Alabama, and authorizing and empowering said company to exercise and enjoy its corporate powers and franchises in the State of Texas.

div2.p:
Section 1. Be it declared, by the representatives of the State of Texas, (under and by virtue of the authority of the Congress of the United States of America,) in Convention assembled, That “the New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company” a corporation, in-
corporated, organized and existing under and by virtue of its act of incorporation, duly enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Alabama, entitled “an act to incorporate the New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company,” approved November 24th, 1866, and amended by an act approved February 12th, 1861, and further amended by an act approved August 12th, 1868, is hereby recognized and approved as a body politic and corporate; with all the powers, privileges, rights and franchises granted to it by the said State of Alabama, in and by said act of incorporation, and the acts amendatory thereof, hereby adopting, confirming and approving all the provisions of said act of incorporation granted to said company, and the acts amendatory thereof, so far as the same may be applicable to this State. The said company is hereby in-
vested with all the powers, privileges and franchises granted to it in its said act of incorporation, and in the acts amendatory thereof, and is empowered and authorized to exercise and enjoy the same in the State of Texas, and to have, exercise and enjoy all the rights, powers, privileges and franchises pertaining to corporate bodies within the State of Texas, necessary for the full enjoyment and exercise of the said rights, powers, privileges and franchises granted and secured to it by its said act of in-
corporation, and the acts amendatory thereof; and necessary to secure, attain and accomplish the objects and purposes of its incorporation, in the same manner, and with the like power and effect as if said company had been incorporated by virtue of any grant or law of the State of Texas; subject only to the conditions, provisions and restrictions of this ordinance and act as hereinafter set forth.

Sec. 2, Be it further declared, That to enable the said company to accomplish the purposes and objects of its incorporation, the furtherance and pursuit of which in the State of Texas is hereby granted, the said company is empowered and authorized,

First, To locate, construct and build, and thereafter to own, main-
tain, manage and use, by running thereon its engines, cars and trains of cars, a railroad with one or more tracks, and suitable turnouts, of such guage and construction, and upon such a course of route, as may be deemed by a majority of the directors of the said company, most proper, expedient or necessary, and most for the interest of the said company, and best adapted for the public accommodation, from any point on the line between the State of Texas and the State of Louisiana, in the county of Orange or in the county of Newton; towards and to any point on the line between the State of Texas and Mexico, in the county of Maverick or in the county of Webb; and if the majority of the di-
rectors of the said company shall not deem it to be expedient and for the interest of the said company to locate the line of said railroad through the city of Houston, in the county of Harris, then the said company shall construct a branch railroad from such point upon the said main line of railroad in the county of Harris as may be deemed most proper and ex-
pedient by a majority of the directors of said company, towards and to any point within the corporate limits of the said city of Houston, which may be acquired by said company for the uses and purposes of its legiti-
mate business. And such branch railroad shall be deemed and taken to form a part of the said main line of railroad from the line be-
tween the State of Texas and the State of Louisiana, to the line between the State of Texas and Mexico, as hereinbefore designated; and whenever the said main line of railroad is referred to herein, such conference shall be deemed to include the said branch line of railroad, as a continuation and part of the said main line of railroad; and all the provisions hereof shall be applicable to said branch line of railroad in the same manner as to the said main line of railroad.

Second, To locate, construct and to build and thereafter to own, maintain, manage and use, by running thereon its engines, cars and tiains of cars, a railroad with one or more tracks, and suitable turn-
outs, of such guage and construction, and upon such a course or route, as may be deemed by a majority of the directors of the said company most proper, expedient or necessary, and most for the interest of the said company and best adapted for the public accommo-
dation, from any point on the line between the State of Texas and the State of Louisiana, in the county of Newton, towards and to any point in or east of Hardeman county, on the northern boundary
Constitutional Convention.of the State of Texas, which may deemed by a majority of the directors of said company most proper and expedient, in order to connect the said line of railroad, and to connect the same with any railroad which may hereafter be built by way of the Albuquerque or Santa Fe route, to the Pacific.

Third, For the purpose of connecting its said mam lines of railroad, hereinbefore designated, with other railroads within the State of Texas, or with any mines or manufactories within the State of Texas, the said company is empowered and authorized to locate, construct and build, and thereafter to own, maintain, manage and use by running thereon its engines, cars and trains of ears, such branch railroads and tracks as a majority of the directors of said company may from time to time deem to be proper and expedient and for the interest of the said company to own and use.

Fourth, To construct, establish or purchase, in the State of Texas, and thereafter to own, maintain and use, suitable wharves, piers, ware-
houses, steamboats, harbors, depots, stations and other works and ap-
purtenances connected with, and incidental to, said railroad and the business of said company, and by the directors of said company deemed necessary and expedient for said company to own and manage.

Fifth, To fake, transport, carry and convey persons and property upon its said railroads, and its boats, by power oil steam or any other power; and to receive for the same such tolls and charges as shall be established by the directors of said company.

Sixth, To obtain and receive by purchase, grant, gift, devise and bequest, and to have and to hold real and personal estate in the State of Texas, for the objects, purposes and business of said company, and to the extent provided and set forth in its said act of incorporation, and in this ordinance and act, excepting that in the taking and holding of lands for the use of said company, as lands taken for public use, the said company shall take and obtain the same as in this ordinance and act provided.

Seventh, To lay out its said railroads, and to construct the same, not exceeding two hundred feet in width, upon any lands of the State of Texas, and to take, hold and use for the purpose of neces-
sary depots, station’s, cuttings, turnouts, and for obtaining stone, gravel, earth and timber, for the construction of its said railroads, any lands of the State of Texas, lying along or upon or adjacent to the route or course of said railroads, that may be necessary for the construction, maintenance and security of such railroads; provided however, that any and all damages that may be occasioned, or that may arise to any person, corporation or association, other than the State of Texas, by the taking and using such lands and materials
Ordinances Passed by thefor the use of said company as aforesaid, shall be assessed and paid for by said company as provided in this ordinance and act.

Eighth. To construct and maintain its said railroads, or any part of the same, and to have the right of way therefor, across, or along, or upon any waters, water-course, river, lake, bay, inlet, street, highway, turnpike or canal, within the State of Texas, which the course of said railroads may intersect, touch or cross, provided the said company shall preserve any water-course, street, highway, turnpike or canal, which its said rail-
roads may pass upon, along, intersect, touch or cross, so as not to impair its usefulness to the public unnecessarily; or, if temporarily impaired in and during the construction of said railroads, the said company shall re-
store the same to its former state, or to such a state that its usefulness and convenience to the public shall not be unnecessarily or materially im-
paired or injured.

Ninth. That the said company is hereby authorized and empow-
ered to obtain by grant or otherwise, from any incorporated city or village, within the State of Texas, that may be situated upon its railroad or rail-
roads, any rights, privileges or franchises, that any of said incorporated cities or villages may choose to grant, in reference to the construction, maintenance and management of the railroad of said company, its de-
pots, cars, locomotives, and its business, within the limits of such, or any of said incorporated cities or villages; and any such incorporated city or village, as hereinbefore named, is hereby authorized and empowered to grant to said company any such rights, privileges, and franchises, as it may deem proper and advisable; and such rights, privileges and fran-
chises, when granted to, and accepted by said company, from any such incorporated, city or village, shall be deemed and taken as rights, privi-
leges and franchises, vested and confirmed in said company, and not liable to be thereafter revoked, changed, injured or impaired, except with the consent of said company.

Sec. 3. Be it further declared, That the said company being hereby authorized to purchase, receive and hold such real estate as may be necessary and convenient in accomplishing the ob-
ject for which this company is organized, it may, by its agents, sur-
veyors, engineers and servants, enter upon all lands and tenements through which it may conclude to make such railroads; and sur-
vey, lay out and construct the same, and may agree and contract for the land, or right of way, with the owners of the land through which it intends to make said roads. In case said lands belong to the estate of any deceased person, then with the executor or admin-
istrator of such; or in case of the same belonging to a minor person non compos mentis, then with his or her guardian; or in case said
Constitutional Convention.lands be held by trustees of schools, sections, or other trustees of es-
tates, then with such trustees.

And said executors, administrators, guardians and trustees are hereby declared competent for such estate, person or minor, to contract with said company, to use, occupy and possess the lands of such estates, per-
sons, minors or trustees, so far as may be useful or necessary for the purpose of said railroads; and the act and deed of such executors, ad-
ministrators, guardians, or trustees in relation thereto, shall pass a title-
in such lands, in the same manner as if the said deeds or act was made-
or done by a legal owner of full age and sound mind; and such executor, administrator, guardian or trustee shall account to those interested in their respective bonds for the amount paid him in pursuance of such agreement and composition; and if the said company and the parties representing lands prefer, they may refer the question of compensation to arbitrators, mutually chosen, whose award, or that of their umpire, (in case of disagreement,) shall vest title according to its terms.

Sec. 4. Be it further declared, That if the said company is unable to agree for the purchase of any real estate or the right of way there-
upon, or any estate therein, required for the use and purposes of the said company, as provided in the preceding section, or is unable for any cause to obtain the title or right of way therein, it shall have the right to ac-
quire title to the same in the following manner: The said company may apply to the Supreme Court of the State of Texas, at any general or special term, or to any judge thereof in vacation, for the appoint-
ment of commissioners of appraisal, or it may apply for such ap-
pointment to any District Court of the county in which the said land lies, at any general or special term, or to any judge thereof in vaca-
tion. Such application shall be made in writing, and signed by the President or one of the Directors of said company, or by an agent or attorney of said company authorized for that purpose, and shall sub-
stantially set forth and state:

First. It must be entitled so as to describe the court wherein, or the judge to whom the application is made, and the character of the appli-
cation.
Second. The name and official character of the person applying in behalf of the company, must be stated.

Third. The real estate which the company seeks to acquire, must he described by metes and bounds, and the estate therein which the com-
pany seeks to acquire must be set forth; and several parcels of land, owned by different persons, may be included in one application.
Fourth. That the company has not been able to acquire the estate in said lands required, and the reason of such inability.

Fifth. The names of all owners or parties interested in said real estate, so far as the same are known to the applicant, must be set forth; and if not known, that fact must be stated. A copy of such appli-
cation, and notice of the time and place the same will be presented, must be served on all persons named in said application, as owners or interested in said real estate, at least five days prior to the presentation of the same; provided such owners so named are residents, and can be found within the State of Texas, and are not infants, idiots, or persons of unsound mind.

Sec. 5. Be it further declared, That on presentation of the applica-
tion to the court or judge therein named, and no person appearing to oppose said application, and whenever it shall satisfactorily appear from said application and proof thereunto attached, that service of notice of the time and place of the presentation of said application upon all the owners and persons interested in said lands has been made, the said court or the judge thereof, shall forthwith make an order ap-
pointing three disinterested and competent persons, who reside in the county where the premises are situated, or an adjoining county thereto, as commissioners to ascertain and appraise the compensation to be made to the owners or persons interested in the real estate proposed to be taken by said company for its purposes, and shall fix the time and place for the first meeting of said commissioners. In case any person who shall be the owner, or who shall have a vested interest in said premises, shall appear at the time and place of the presentation of such application, the said court or judge, before making said appointment of commissioners, may hear such person and said company in relation to any persons proposed for appointment as such commissioners, their place of residence, competency and interest; and after such hearing, the said court or judge shall make an appointment of three commissioners as aforesaid, in accordance with the discretion and judgment of said court or judge. In case it shall appear by said application that any person, or any of the persons owning or interested in the said pre-
mises described in the application, or in any part of the same, are not known to the said company, or are not residents of the county wherein said real estate is situated, or cannot be found therein after due diligence, or are infants, idiots, or persons of unsound mind, then and in such case the said court or judge, before making said appointment of commissioners, shall make such inquiries as to such owners and parties interested in said premises, and shall make such orders for service of notice upon them, or upon any person in regard to said application, and such other order, or orders in the premises, as the said court or judge may deem necessary, proper and just, and shall then make such appointment of commissioners as aforesaid;
Constitutional Convention.and in connection therewith, make such orders as to the service of any future notice upon the owners of said premises, of the meeting and ap-
praisement of said commissioners, and the confirmation of the same, as may seem to said court or judge equitable and just.

Sec. 6. Be it further declared, That the commissioners so appointed, or a majority of them, shall hold their first meeting at a time and place appointed by the court or judge, and may adjourn from time to time at their discretion. They shall take and subscribe an oath, before any officer authorized to administer oaths in the State of Texas, to the effect that they, and each of them, will impartially and to the best of their judgment and ability, perform the duties of said commissioners. Any one of said commissioners may issue subpoenas and administer oaths to witnesses. Whenever they meet to take testimony, or hear the parties, except by the appointment of the said court or judge, or pur-
suant to adjournment, they shall cause reasonable notice of such meet-
ing to be given to any of the parties in interest, who shall have thereto-
fore appeared before them, or to their agent or attorney. They shall hear the proofs and allegations of the parties, and reduce the same to writing. And after all the testimony offered in the case, that in the judgment of the said commissioners is pertinent to the value of the said premises, is taken, they, or a majority of them, shall, without unneces-
sary delay, ascertain and determine the compensation which ought justly and equitably to be made by the said company to the owners or persons interested in said real estate, appraised by them; and said com-
missioners shall take into consideration the advantages that the said owners or persons interested in said real estate may derive from the construction of the said proposed railroad, for which said real estate is proposed to be taken. They shall make a report in writing to the court or judge by whom they were appointed, which shall contain the proceedings in the case before them, with the minutes of the testimony taken by them, if any, and their award and determination. They shall be compensated for service as such commissioners by the said company, at the rate of five dollars per day for actual service.

Sec. 7. Be it further declared, That on such report being made by said commissioners, the court or judge shall appoint a time or place for the hearing of said company, and all parties interested in said lands, in regard to the confirmation of said report; and shall, by order, direct the manner and form of the service of any notice of the same upon any persons that, in the judgment of the said court of judge, should be notified: and on the day of such hearing, if no person shall appear to oppose the confirmation of the said report, the same shall be confirmed by the said court or judge; and an
Ordinances Passed by theorder shall be made reciting the proceedings of the appraisal, the con-
firmation of the same, and a description of the real estate, and directing to whom the money or value of said real estate is to be paid, or in what manner the same shall be deposited by said company for the use and benefit of said owners. And if any person shall appear to oppose the confirmation of said report, the said court or judge shall hear the parties for and against such confirmation, and if said court or judge shall decide in favor of such confirmation, then the same proceeding shall be had in the premises as heretofore provided, in case no person appeared to op-
pose such confirmation; and if said court or judge shall decide against such confirmation, an order shall be entered directing said commis-
sioners, or other commissioners named in said order, to proceed to re-
appraisal of the said premises, the proceedings of which shall be after-
wards conducted as in the first instance, except that the appraisal and report of the commissioners on the re-appraisal ordered shall be final, and shall be confirmed by said court or judge, and the order of said court or judge confirming any appraisal, as aforesaid, shall be final and conclusive on all parties interested.

Sec. 8. Be it further declared, That the order of the said court or judge confirming an appraisal of lands, as heretofore provided, or a certified copy of the same, shall be filed in the office of the Clerk of the District Court of the county in which said real estate appraised shall be situate, and there shall remain a record; and such order, so entered and filed, shall vest in said company the lands described therein, and such estate as may be therein set forth, on the payment, or tender of payment, or deposit of the amount of the appraisal and damages by said company, as provided in said order; and said order, or a duly cer-
tified copy thereof, with proof of such payment and deposit, as therein provided, will be considered as legal evidence of the title and estate of said company to the real estate described therein. All real estate acquired by appraisal by said company, under and pursuant to this ordinance and act, shall be deemed to be acquired for public use.

Sec. 9. Be it further declared, That the said company shall be exempt from all taxes in the State of Texas, of whatever name or nature, including State, county, town, city and municipal taxes, ex-
cept that a State tax of three per centum on all dividends declared and paid to the stockholders of said company, from time to time, shall be paid by said company to the States through and in which the railroads of said company shall be constructed and maintained. And the amount of said tax paid to each State shall be in the same proportion to the whole amount as the length of said railroads, or either of them, constructed and maintained in each State, shall bear
Constitutional Convention.to the collective length of the said railroads constructed and maintained in all the States; and the proportion of said tax to be paid to the State of Texas shall be due and payable, and shall be paid to the Treasurer of the State by said company at the time any such dividends shall be so declared, and shall be due and payable by said company. And the offi-
cers, agents and servants of said company within the State of Texas shall be exempt from jury duty, and from military duty, except in case of invasion or insurrection.

Sec. 10. Be it further declared, That the said company is hereby authorized to cross, intersect, join and unite its railroads with any other railroad heretofore or hereafter constructed in the State of Texas, at any point upon its route, and upon the ground of such other railroad com-
pany, with the necessary turnouts, sidings, switches and other conveni-
ences, in furtherance of the objects of its connections. And every rail-
road company in the State of Texas, whose railroad shall be hereafter intersected by the railroads of this company, shall unite with it in form-
ing such intersection and connections, and grant the facilities aforesaid; and if the said railroad companies cannot agree upon the points and manner of such crossings, intersections and connections, and the divis-
ion and apportionment of the costs and expenses of the same between said companies, the same shall be ascertained and determined by com-
missioners appointed by the court, as is provided in this ordinance and act, in respect to acquiring title to real estate.

Sec. 11. Be it further declared, That the said company is empowered and authorized to purchase or lease from any railroad company or cor-
poration, its railroad and the charter, franchises, property and appur-
tenances thereof, and maintain and use the same as a part of the prop-
erty of the said company; and the said company is also authorized and empowered to enter into any mutual contract with any other railroad company or corporation by which the capital stock and property of said other company or corporation shall become merged and consolidated with this said company, and into one joint and common stock, and be and exist as one company, possessing and enjoying all the powers, fran-
chises, rights and privileges granted to or vested in each and all of the companies so consolidated or united by the State of Texas, or by other States, or by the United States, through which the railroad of said com-
pany so consolidated and united may pass; the provisions of any statute heretofore passed by the State of Texas to the contrary notwithstanding.

Sec. 12. Be it further declared, That the said company is authorized and empowered, from time to time, to borrow money or to purchase property upon its own credit, for the purpose of con-
Ordinances Passed by thestructing and maintaining said railroads, or establishing continuous and connecting lines of railroad, as heretofore, and in its act of incorpo-
ration provided; and as evidence of the indebtedness of said company for such loans or the purchase of such property, may issue its corporate bonds or promissory notes, bearing interest at a rate not exceeding eight per cent. per annum; and to secure the payment of said bonds and notes, may mortgage its railroads, its capital stock, its corporate, franchises, and any of its real or personal property, or any part or por-
tion of the same; and it may by its president, or other officers and agents, duly authorized by its directors, sell, dispose of, or negotiate such bonds and notes, or may sell, dispose of, or negotiate its capital stock; said capital stock being declared to be personal property, and transferable as such; or any of its personal property, at such times and places, and at such rates, and for such prices, either within or without the limits of the State of Texas, as in the judgment of said company, or its directors, will best advance its interests; and if such bonds, notes or stock are thus sold at a discount, such sale shall be in all respects valid and binding upon this company, and such stock, bonds or notes shall be as valid for the par value thereof as if the same had been sold at par value; and, whereas, the line of the railroad of said company, as intended to be constructed, will extend through several States, it is hereby declared that the cars and engines, and all personal property which said company may acquire, shall, for the purposes of this ordi-
nance and act, and for all mortgage purposes, be deemed part of the realty, and be apportioned according to the number of miles of railroad constructed and owned by the company in each State; so that the num-
ber of cars and engines and amount of personal property which shall be deemed to belong to the portion of the company’s railroad con-
structed and lying within the limits of either of said States, shall at all times bear the same proportion to the whole number of cars and en-
gines, and whole amount of personal property owned by the company, which the number of miles of railroad of the company constructed and lying within such State shall bear to the aggregate number of miles of the railroad of the company constructed in all of said States.

Sec. 13. Be it further declared, That the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall be entitled to receive, and shall receive from the State of Texas, a grant of sixteen sections (of six hundred and forty acres each) of land for every mile of railroad, (exclusive of side tracks) within the State of Texas, which the said company shall construct and put in running order, and which shall form a part of its main line of railroad, designated and described in clause first of section 2, of this ordinance
Constitutional Convention.and act; or which shall form a part of its main line of railroad, desig-
nated and described in clause second of section 2, of this ordinance and act; or which shall form a part of either of said main lines of railroad, or of any branch thereof, as provided in clause third of section 2, of this ordinance and act; and which shall be constructed and put in running order by the said company within ten years from and after the acceptance of this ordinance and act by the said company, as herein provided for; and for any part or portion of its said main lines of railroad or for any part or portion of any branch thereof, which the said company may build within the State of Texas after the expiration of the aforesaid term of ten years, the said company shall not (for any such part or por-
tion) be entitled to receive lands from the State of Texas under the provisions of this ordinance and act; the lands hereby granted to the said company shall be surveyed and located by said company, and the title to the said lands shall be finally transferred to and vested in the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, by and from the State of Texas, in accordance with the provisions of section 14, of this ordinance and act, and not otherwise.

Sec. 14. Be it further declared, That whenever the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall have constructed and put in running order, within the State of Texas, a section of forty miles, or more, of its said main line of railroad, designated and described in clause first of section 2, of this ordinance and act, or of its said main line of railroad, designated and described in clause second of sec-
tion 2, of this ordinance and act, or of either of the said main lines of railroad or of any branch thereof, as provided for in clause third of sec-
tion 2, of this ordinance and act, the said company may give notice thereof to the Governor of the State of Texas, and request that the lands pro-
vided for and granted to the said company in and by the provisions of section 13, of this ordinance and act, shall be allotted to said company to the extent of sixteen sections of land (of six hundred and forty acres each) for each and every mile of railroad so constructed; and said com-
pany may designate in said request and notice any lands of the public domain of the State of Texas subject to location and entry, describing, as nearly as practicable, the lands applied for, and which it is desired shall be allotted to said company. It shall be the duty of said Governor, upon receiving said notice and request, and upon being satisfied that the portions of said railroad described in said notice and request, have been constructed by the said company, by the report of the engineers of said company, under oath or by other satisfactory proof, to cause said notice and request to be filed in the General Land Office of the State of Texas, and immediately there-
Ordinances Passed by theafter to cause the said lands set forth and described in said notice and request to be allotted and set apart for said company, and a certificate of such allotment, over the seal of the State of Texas and the signa-
ture of the Governor, to be made and given to the said company; and the lands described in said notice and request, and in said certificate, shall thereafter be exempt from any other future location, entry or pre-emption privilege, and shall be considered as located, allotted and set apart for the said company, as in this ordinance and act provided.

When the said company shall have completed and put in running order that part or portion of the main line of railroad designated and described in clause first of section 2, of this ordinance and act, lying between the point where it shall intersect and cross the eastern boundary of the State of Texas and the city of Houston, and shall have also completed and put in running order three sections, of forty miles each, of the main line of railroad, designated and described in clause second of section 2, of this ordinance and act; and when the said company shall have received from the Governor the certificate of the location and allotment of that part or portion of the lands granted to the said company by the terms and provisions of section 13 of this ordinance and act, apportioned, due and pertaining to such completed parts or portions of the said main lines of railroad, then the said company shall be entitled to receive and shall re-
ceive, from the State of Texas, the title to the said lands, and all of them which shall have been located and allotted to the said company for such completed parts or portions of the said main lines of railroad; and it shall then be the duty of the Governor to cause patents to be duly made and issued to the said company by and from the State of Texas, convey-
ing the said lands theretofore located and allotted to the said company in fee simple. And thereafter the said company shall be entitled to re-
ceive, and shall receive, from the State of Texas, the title to the lands, and all of them apportioned, due and pertaining to each section of forty miles of its railroads, in accordance with the provisions of this ordinance and act, at the same time that the said company shall be entitled to re-
ceive the certificates of allottment therefore, in accordance with the pro-
visions of this section of this ordinance and act; and it shall be the duty of the Governor to cause patents to be duly made and issued to the said company by and from the State of Texas, conveying said lands so allotted to said company in fee simple, at the time of delivering to the said company the certificates of allotment therefore, in accordance with the provisions of this ordinance and act.

Sec. 15. Be it further declared, That the said company may ac-
cept the terms, conditions and provisions of this ordinance and act
Constitutional Convention.at any time after its passage, and within four months from and after the future approval and acceptance of a constitution for the State of Texas, by the Congress of the United States, by a written acceptance signed by a majority of the directors of the said company, and addressed to the Governor of the State of Texas; and in case of such acceptance by the said company, the said company shall be entitled to the benefit of all the provisions of this ordinance and act, and shall possess and enjoy the rights and franchises granted to said company by the State of Texas in this ordinance and act; and such grants and the engage-
ments herein made and entered into on the part of the State of Texas, shall be deemed to be, and shall be, binding contracts between the State of Texas and the said company, not to be impaired, disturbed, or modified, by subsequent legislation, except with the consent and on the petition of the said company.

Sec. 16. Be it further declared, That any and every county of the State of Texas, situate upon or adjacent to the main or branch lines of the railroads of the said company within the State of Texas, as such lines are or may be hereafter located by said company, is authorized and empowered to subscribe for, take and pay for, the capital stock of said company, as hereinafter provided.

The said company, by its president, and a majority of its directors, may, in writing, propose to any such county, that it shall subscribe for and take an amount of said capital stock, to be named in said proposal, at a certain price per share, and pay for the same in such bonds of the county as shall be set forth in said proposal. The said proposal may be delivered to the treasurer of the county to which the proposal may be made, and said treasurer shall thereupon, and within ten days after re-
ceiving such proposal, call a special meeting of the board of commission-
ers of said county, to assemble within ten days, at a time and place to be named in such notice, to consider said proposal; and the said board of commissioners shall assemble at the time and place named, and shall consider the same; and if a majority of the whole number of the commissioners of such county shall vote for a resolution to accept said proposition, or any other proposition at the time made to said county by said company, then and in such case the said resolution shall be submitted to the electors of the county, at an election to be called by said board of commissioners, and to be held in said county within thirty days after the said meeting of the board of com-
missioners. Such election shall be held and conducted at the time appointed, in the same manner and form as by law provided for holding any election for county officers. The notice of said elec-
tion shall state the substance of the said proposal of said company, and of the resolution adopted by the board of commissioners, and shall
Ordinances Passed by thedirect that the electors shall vote by ballot at said election for and against the resolution; and if a majority of the ballots cast at said election shall be in favor of said resolution, it shall be considered, deemed and declared that said county has subscribed and taken the stock of said company, set forth and described in said proposal and resolution, and agreed to pay for the same in the bonds of the county, as hereinafter provided, and the faith and credit of said county shall be pledged to pay for the same; and such action by said company and said county shall be deemed and declared to be a valid and existing contract between said county and said company, and the stock and bonds issued in the formal fulfillment of the same, shall be deemed legal and valid stock and bonds, and the said bonds, and each of them, shall be deemed to be a legal and valid debt against said county, in favor of any future owner or holder of the same.

Sec. 17. Be it further declared, That after the approval and con-
firmation by the electors of the county of the said resolution of the board of commissioners, the treasurer of said county shall prepare the bonds of the county, as authorized by said resolution, and execute the same in the name of the said county, and the clerk of said county shall attest the same, and affix the seal of the county thereto; and the said treasurer shall receive from said company the certificates of the shares of capital stock set forth and described in said proposal and resolution, and shall cause them to be registered in the name of said county, and shall deliver said bonds of said county to said company in payment therefor; and the said treasurer shall place the said shares of the cap-
ital stock in the treasury of the county, subject only to the order and disposal of the board of commissioners of said county, and said capital stock may be voted upon under the direction of said commissioners, while the same shall be and remain the property of said county. And the board of commissioners of said county are authorized, empowered, and directed to impose, levy and collect a tax, from time to time, upon the real and personal estate situate within said county, in the same man-
ner as other State and county taxes shall be imposed, levied and col-
lected, for the purpose of paying the principal and interest of said county bonds, as the same may become due and payable; and the prin-
cipal and interest of said county bonds shall be paid, whenever the same become due, by the treasurer of said county, at his office, with and from any funds or moneys in his possession, belong to said county, or with and from any funds or moneys in the treasury of said county.

Sec. 18. Be it further declared, That any and every incorpor-
ated city within the State of Texas, situate upon or adjacent to the main or branch lines of the railroads of said company within the
Constitutional Convention.State of Texas, as such lines are or may be hereafter located by said company, is authorized and empowered to subscribe for, take and pay for the capital stock of said company as hereinafter provided. The said company by its president and a majority of its directors, may, in writing, propose to any such city, that it shall subscribe for and take an amount of said capital stock, named and set forth in said proposal, at a certain price per share, and pay for the same in such bonds of the city as shall be set forth in said proposal. The said proposal may be delivered to the Mayor of the city to which the proposal may be made, and said Mayor shall thereupon and within ten days after re-
ceiving such proposal, submit the said proposal to the board of aldermen and common council of such city, or to any other official board or body of said city having jurisdiction to enact ordinances for such city; and if a majority of such board of aldermen, common council or other official board or body, shall, by a resolution, accept the said proposal, then it shall be the duty of the said Mayor to proclaim and order a special election of said city to be held within thirty days after the adoption of such resolution, to which he shall submit the said proposal approved, and the resolution adopted, and said special election shall be held and conducted at the time appointed, in the same manner and form as by law provided for holding any election for city officers in such city; and the electors who vote thereat shall vote by ballot for or against said pro-
posal and resolution, and if a majority of votes cast at such election shall be in favor of such proposal and resolution, such city shall be considered, deemed and declared to have subscribed for and taken the stock of said company, set forth and described in said proposal and resolutions, and the faith and credit of said city shall be pledged to pay for the same, as in said proposal and resolution provided; and the Mayor of said city is authorized, empowered and directed to prepare and execute the bonds of said city, and on presentation of the certificates of the capital stock of said company, set forth and described in said proposal and resolution, to deliver said bonds of such city to said com-
pany; and such bonds shall be deemed and held to be a valid and legal debt against such city, to be paid by such city according to their terms and conditions; and the officers of such city, having charge of the im-
position and levy of taxes in said city for municipal purposes, shall im-
pose, levy and collect a tax from time to time upon the real and per-
sonal estate situate within said city, to provide the monies and funds to pay any such bonds so issued, and the interest thereon, and shall pay the same as they shall become due and payable; and said stock so taken shall be registered in the name of such city, and shall be under the con-
trol and at the disposal of the Mayor and common council thereof.

Sec 19. Be it further declared, That the said company can sue and be sued only in such courts of the State of Texas as are courts of rec-
ord, and in such manner and form only as corporations of the State of Texas can be sued; and service of process in any action against the said company can be made only by service of the same upon either the president, secretary, treasurer or any of the directors of said company, or upon an agent of the said company, resident of the State of Texas, and designated by the company to receive such service; and it shall be the duty of the company to designate one of its agents upon each dis-
tinct and separate line of its railroad, within the State of Texas, and who shall reside within the State of Texas, as the agent or agents upon whom such service of process can be made; and to give public notice thereof by advertisement for four successive weeks, in a newspaper published at some place upon each line of its railroad within the State of Texas, and like public notice shall be given whenever any change is made in such agency or agencies.

Sec. 20. Be it further declared, That if any person or persons will, or shall willfully do, or cause to be done, any act or acts whatever, where-
by any building, construction or work of said company, or any engine, machine or structure, or any matter or thing appertaining to the same shall be stopped, obstructed, impaired, weakened, injured or destroyed, the person so offending shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor, and shall forfeit and pay to the said company double the amount of dam-
ages sustained by reason of such offences or injury, to be recovered in the name of said company, with costs of suit by action of debt; and such offences shall also be subject to indictment, and shall be, on con-
viction, sentenced to imprisonment at the discretion of the court, for a period not exceeding eighteen months.

Sec. 21. Whereas, because of the forfeiture of its charter, and on account of the non-payment of a large sum of money, principal and in-
terest, due the special School Fund by the Texas and New Orleans Rail-
road Company, formerly known by the corporate name of the Sabine and Galveston Bay Railroad and Lumber Company, the railroad, with all the other property and franchises of said company are to be sold, at public auction or otherwise, by the State of Texas: Be it further or-
dained and enacted, That when such sale is had, unless there shall be bid by others a sum sufficient to pay the amount then due for principal and interest of the debt due the School Fund of the State of Texas, and the expenses of the sale, and if at such sale the New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Rail-
road Company shall bid a sum sufficient to pay the amount due for principal, interest and expenses aforesaid, and shall be the high-
Constitutional Convention.est bidder, the said railroad and property and franchises shall be struck down and sold to the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Rail-
road Company; and in that event the Governor shall receive from the last named purchaser, in payment of the purchase money, to the extent of the amount due the State of Texas for principal and interest as afore-
said, and the expenses of the sale, and in lieu of cash, the bond of the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, payable twenty years after date, with interest at six per cent. per annum, pay-
able semi-annually, in lawful currency of the United States of America. The payment of the principal and interest of Said bond to be secured by the deposit in the Treasury of the State of Texas of an equal amount of first mortgage bonds of said last named company, provided said first mortgage bonds are not issued for a greater sum than $25,000 per mile for each mile of railroad covered by said first mortgage; such bond for the purchase money to be delivered to the Governor within thirty days after the sale, and the residue of the purchase money, if any, shall be paid in cash; and the Governor shall thereupon deliver to the said pur-
chaser a deed conveying to the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, the railroad properties and franchises sold. And in case the first mortgage bonds aforesaid should not be at that time in readi-
ness to be deposited as collateral as aforesaid, the said purchaser shall, at the time of receiving the deed, deposit in the Treasury of the State of Texas, as collateral security for the payment of said purchase money bond, such bonds or other securities as shall be satisfactory to the Gov-
ernor, which last mentioned bonds or other securities shall be surrendered to said purchaser on the substitution by it of first mortgage bonds afore-
said.

Sec. 22. Be it further declared, That in case the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall at said sale become the purchaser of the railroad and properties and franchises hereinbefore di-
rected to be sold, and shall pay or secure the purchase money in the manner hereinbefore provided, the said purchaser, its successors and as-
signs, shall have and enjoy a good and indefeasible title to said railroad and properties and franchises so sold, free from all liens or incumbrances, and the State of Texas hereby warrants such title to said purchaser, and agrees to hold it harmless against all liens and incumbrances of every nature, prior to the conveyance so to be executed by the Governor of the State of Texas; and the said purchaser, its successors and assigns, may remove from the road-bed of the railroad so sold, all the iron rails, chairs and spikes, or any part thereof, and use the same in the con-
struction of its line of railroad in the State of Texas, west of the
Ordinances Passed by theColorado river, and shall not, by reason of such removal, be subjected to any forfeiture of the franchises of said Texas and New Orleans Railroad Company.

Sec. 23. Be it further declared, That in case the New Orleans, Mo-
bile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall purchase or lease the rail-
road of the Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railroad Company, or shall hereafter desire to purchase of the State of Texas the bonds given by the said last named company to the State of Texas, for the money heretofore advanced to said last named company out of the Special School Fund, the State of Texas will sell, deliver, and transfer said bonds to the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, on receiv-
ing from it in payment therefor the bonds of the said New Orleans, Mo-
bile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, for a sum equal to the principal and interest then due to the State of Texas on said special School Fund bends, payable twenty years after date, with interest at six per cent. per annum, payable semi-annually, in lawful currency of the United States of America, secured by the deposit in the Treasury of the State of Texas, of an equal amount of first mortgage bonds of the last named company; provided, said first mortgage bonds are not issued for a greater sum than $25,000 per mile for each mile of railroad covered by said first mortgage; and on such payment and deposit being made, the said bonds of the Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railroad Company, held by the State of Texas, shall be surrendered to the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company; and the said last named company shall thereupon succeed to, and have and possess all the lien, right, title and interest which the State of Texas now has by virtue of the last men-
tioned bonds, in and upon the railroad and franchise’s and other prop-
erties of the said Buffalo Bayou and Colorado Railroad Company, and shall have the same right to enforce said lien by sale, as is now vested in the State of Texas; and such sale may be made by the president of the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, with like effect as it might be made by the Governor of the State of Texas, if the State of Texas remained the owner of the bonds. And in case the first mortgage bonds aforesaid should not be at the time of such purchase and transfer, in readiness to be deposited as collateral as aforesaid, the said purchaser shall, at the time of receiving the said Special School Fund bonds, deposit in the Treasury of the State of Texas, as collateral se-
curity for the payment of said purchase money bond, such bonds or other securities, as shall be satisfactory to the Governor; which last men-
tioned bonds or other securities, shall be surrendered to said pur-
Constitutional Convention.chaser on the substitution by it of first mortgage bonds as aforesaid.

Sec. 24. Be it further declared, That in case the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall become the purchaser or owner of the railroad of the Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railroad Company, or any part thereof, the former company may, by resolution of its Board of Directors, incorporate its said railroad, or such part thereof as it may acquire, in the line of railroad of the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company; and there-
upon, the part so incorporated shall be deemed, for the purposes of this ordinance and act, a part of the railroad constructed by the New Or-
leans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company within the State of Texas; and the said company shall enjoy in respect of the part so incor-
porated, all the rights and privileges in respect to the grants of lands, and all other rights and privileges of every description to which it is or may be entitled under this ordinance and act, in respect of the rail-
road actually constructed by it within the State of Texas; and in case of such purchase or lease of the said railroad of the said Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railroad Company, by the said New Orleans, Mo-
bile and Chattanooga Railroad Company, the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company is empowered and authorized to change the guage of said railroad, and to change the eastern terminus of said railroad from Harrisburg to the city of Houston, and to change the location and line, and to transfer the rails of so much of said rail-
road as the directors of the said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company may deem necessary to effect such change of ter-
minus and of line.

Sec. 25. Be it further declared, That this ordinance and act shall take effect from and after its passage, and shall be favorably and liber-
ally construed so as to favor all the purposes and objects of the same, and the operations of the provisions thereof; and that said New Orleans, Mobile and Chattanooga Railroad Company shall have all the benefits, as if specially named, as granted therein of all such further grant or grants of money, lands, or credit, or any, or all of them, as may be made by the State of Texas by ordinance or statute, to any other railroad corporation, subject to the conditions therein imposed; provided, that in case said company shall think proper to accept such grant, or grants, or any of them, it shall be required to notify the Governor in writing its acceptance of the same.

div2.head: RESOLUTION

opener.salute: Expressing the opinion of the Convention respecting the division of the State of Texas, and providing for the election of delegates to proceed to Washington to represent the condition of the State.

div2.p:
Whereas, The extent of territory of the State of Texas, the con-
flicting interests of the widely separated sections of the State, and the disorganization so largely prevalent, render a division of the State es-
sential to the proper well-being of the people thereof, and the re-
establishment of law and order;
Therefore, be it resolved:
1. That in the opinion of this Convention, the State of Texas ought to be subdivided into States of more convenient size.

2. That the President of this Convention is hereby directed to for-
ward a copy of this preamble and resolution to the Speaker of the House of Representatives and President of the Senate of the United States.

3. That for the purpose of giving the Congress of the United States a correct report of the condition of this State, and to bring to the at-
tention of that body all such matters relating to the condition of the State, and the wants of her loyal people, as may require the considera-
tion and action of Congress, the Convention shall proceed to elect, by ballot, four commissioners, members of this Convention: one of whom shall be a resident of that portion of Texas lying north of the 32d par-
allel of latitude; one a resident of that portion of the State lying east of the Trinity river and south of said 32d parallel; one a resident of that portion of the State lying between the Trinity and Colorado rivers, and south of said 32d parallel; and one a resident of that por-
tion of the State lying west of the Colorado river, and two commission-
ers from the State at large; who, being intimately acquainted with the condition and wants of their respective sections of the State, shall pro-
ceed to Washington city, to bring to the attention of the United States all such matters relating to the condition of this State, and the wants of her loyal people, as in the judgment of this Convention, or of said commissioners, require the consideration and action of Congress.

div2.head: DECLARATION

opener.salute: Incorporating the Rock Creek Bridge and Turnpike Company.

div2.p: Be it declared by tie people of Texas in Convention assembled, That Mrs. W. E. Weaver, her associates and assigns, are hereby created a body corporate and politic, with the rights and privileges hereinafter set forth.

The said Mrs. W. E. Weaver, her associates and assigns, shall have a privilege of constructing a bridge across Rock Creek, in Hopkins county, at the crossing three miles east of Sulphur Springs, and on the road lead-
ing towards Jefferson, Texas; also, the privilege of constructing bridges over the sloughs across said road, also the privilege of levying the bottom of said stream, so as to make the road safe and easy to pass over at all stages of the water.

Be it further declared. That said Mrs. Weaver, her associates and as-
signs, shall have six months from the passage of this declaration, to build and complete the work contemplated by this declaration; and when the work is completed, it shall be the duty of the county judge, and two or more of the county commissioners, to examine the work and road, and if found in good condition, and extending from hill to hill, over the whole of the bottom of said Rock Creek, a distance of about four hundred yards, and done in accordance with this declaration; then they shall certify the facts under their hands and the seal of the county court, and deliver the same to the said Mrs. W. E. Weaver.

Be it further declared, That said Mrs. Weaver, or assigns, with sure-
ties, shall enter into bond in the sum of two thousand dollars, payable to the county judge of Hopkins county, conditioned to pay all damages any person or persons may sustain in crossing over said road and bridge, by reason of said bridge and road being out of repair; and the said bond may be put in suit by any person who has been damaged as aforesaid; said bond to be approved by the county judge, and recorded in the office of the county clerk of Hopkins county.

Be it further declared, When all the conditions hereinbefore set forth have been complied with, the said Mrs. Weaver and her asso-
ciates, or assigns, shall have the privilege of erecting a toll-gate, and to collect the following tolls: for four-horse or ox wagon, fifty cents; for two-horse or ox wagon, twenty-five cents; for carriage or buggy, twenty five cents; for man and horse, ten cents; for loose horses, per head, three cents; for cattle, per head, three cents; for hogs, sheep, or goats, two cents; for footmen, five cents; provided, that
Ordinances Passed by thesaid Mrs. Weaver and her associates shall not have the right to charge citizens of Hopkins county any tolls for passing over said bridge.

Be it further declared, That the exclusive privilege of said road shall extend three miles on either side of said turnpike, and no crossing shall be made on said creek within said limits, without the consent of Mrs. Weaver, her associates, or assigns.

Be it further declared, That the privileges herein granted shall con-
tinue for twenty years from the completion of the work herein contem-
plated.
Be it further declared, That this declaration be in force from and after its passage.

div2.head: DECLARATION

opener.salute: Incorporating the Ship Channel Company from Bolivar Point to Houston.

div2.p:
Section 1. Be it declared by the people of Texas in Convention as-
sembled, That A. S. Richardson, W. J. Hutchins, T. H. Mundine, John Shearn, T. W. House, R. O. Love, W. M. Rice, A. Groesbeck, J. R. Morris, H. R. Allen, S. Harper, and their associates be, and the same are hereby created a body corporate and politic under the name and Style of the “Buffalo Bayou Ship Channel Company,” with authority in said corporate name and capacity to contract, sue and be sued; to plead and be implead-
ed; to acquire real and personal property by gift or purchase; and to sell, grant, mortgage or alienate the same; to borrow money and to issue its bonds, with interest warrants attached thereto; to make by-laws for its own government; to have succession and a common seal; and generally to do and perform all such acts and things as may be necessary to, proper for, or incidental to the carrying out of its obligations; the maintenance of its rights and privileges; and the accomplishment of the objects of the company in accordance with this declaration, and not inconsistent with the Constitution and laws of the State of Texas.

Sec. 2. That said company are herein authorized to form, con-
struct, own and maintain a ship channel from any point at or within the corporate limits of the city of Houston, through Buffalo Bayou, deepening, straightening and widening the same, and through the waters connecting said Buffalo Bayou with the Gulf of Mexico at Bolivar Channel, deepening and removing the obstructions thereof,
Constitutional Convention.to the said Gulf of Mexico at Bolivar Channel, (including the construc-
tion of all locks, gates or dams that may be requisite,) so as to make said ship channel of such continuous depth, width and extent as may be essential for the purposes of foreign and domestic trade and com-
merce, and to build, own and possess such ship basins within or near the corporate limits of the city of Houston, in such numbers, depth, and capacity as may be requisite for the purposes of the company, with all slips, wharves, docks, buildings, and machinery necessary or in any wise pertaining thereto; and the said company are furthermore author-
ized to build, construct and possess such steamboats, tugboats, dredge-
boats, barges, tools, machinery and buildings, or any other property, of any and every kind whatever, as may be necessary to, convenient for, or adapted to the prosecution, management and accomplishment of this declaration, and the purposes of foreign and domestic commerce.

Sec. 3. That said company, in order to accomplish the purposes above specified, are hereby empowered, to perform such dredging and make such excavations, enlarge such streams and deepen such channels; cut off such bends and remove such obstructions in Buffalo Bayou and the bays and waters connecting Buffalo Bayou with the Gulf of Mexico at Bolivar Channel, as may seem desirable and necessary to build said ship basins, and construct said ship channel; and it shall be lawful for said company to appropriate and use such lands in the sev-
eral bayous, streams, gulfs, and waters, or on the banks thereof, or ly-
ing contiguous thereto, as may be requisite for the specific purposes of this declaration; making compensation to the several owners thereof as may be agreed upon by the parties and the company; and if unable to agree, then, in accordance with the general railroad laws of the State, and as provided therein, whenever so using or appropriating said lands.

Sec 4. That the capital stock of said company shall be one mil-
lion dollars, with the privilege of increasing the same to ten millions of dollars, (including all its property, real and personal, franchises and rights to property,) to be divided into shares of one hundred dollars each. Five per cent. to be paid at the time of subscription, and the remainder in instalments of five per cent., as often as it may be called for, after giving thirty days’ notice of said call in some news-
paper published in the city of Houston. Such subscriptions, upon failure of the payment therof, may be enforced by said company in any court having jurisdiction in the State; or may be sold at public auction, after twenty days’ public notice given; the delinquent being liable in the full amount for all deficiencies between the amount so received at the sale thereof and the unpaid balance on his subscription, and for all proper charges and interest thereon. Said
Ordinances Passed by theshares of capital stock shall be deemed personal property, and be trans-
ferable under such rules and regulations as may be provided for in the by-laws of the company. Nevertheless, the board of directors shall have authority to dispose of the shares in its capital stock, in such man-
ner and on such terms as they may deem most conducive to the inter-
ests of the company, and the fulfilment of the objects of this declara-
tion; and shall be furthermore authorized to commence operations when-
ever five hundred shares shall have been taken.

Sec. 5. That the company may receive in payment for its shares, the work of contractors done, hire of agents, laborers and employes, materials or machinery furnished in constructing the enterprise, city or town lots, houses, lands, and real or personal property of any kind what-
ever, bonds of the city of Houston, or any other corporate city or town, or of any county within the limits of the State, and such corporate city, or town, or county, is hereby authorized to subscribe for said stock and issue its bonds for the same. Said property so subscribed shall be at such valuation as may be determined upon between the parties and the company. Each share shall be entitled to one vote either in person or by proxy, and all dividends shall be paid at the principal office in the city of Houston, but no dividend shall at any time be declared impair-
ing the capital stock.

Sec. 6. The management of the said company shall be confided to a board of nine directors, to be elected annually by the stockholders. For the purposes of organization and commencement of the enterprise, the corporators named in the first section of this declaration, shall con-
stitute the first board of directors, to serve one year, until their suc-
cessors are duly elected. The board of directors, when duly constituted, shall elect their own officers at their first meeting, and shall have au-
